text:
38 East First Street, north side between First and Second Avenues, showing P. S. 79.
Board of Education, N.Y.C.
1920.

1st Street, east from the Bowery, as photographed from under the Third Avenue "El". In the background, on First Avenue, is a station of the Second Avenue "El" Line. Between these two similar transportation features is Second Avenue. The three story curved corner building at the right was the infamous Suicide Hall. The owner was "Bloody" McGurk.

July 1928

George L. Balgue, photo

(1)
98-84 1st Street, north side, east of First Avenue, also showing the building adjoining the corner. The view is from Essex Street looking northwest along the clearing for a curve of the Brooklyn line of the city-owned Eighth Avenue subway.
May 9, 1930.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, not showing 78-80 1st Street. The subway is completed, but has not been put into operation.
March 13, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.

(1)
98-84 1st Street, north side, east of First Avenue, also showing the building adjoining the corner. The view is from Essex Street looking northwest along the clearing for a curve of the Brooklyn line of the city-owned Eighth Avenue subway.
May 9, 1930.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, not showing 78-80 1st Street. The subway is completed, but has not been put into operation.
March 13, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.

1st Street, north side, at First Avenue, showing 1st Street station of Second Avenue elevated railroad.

May 9, 1930

P.L. Sperr

(1)
1st Street, north side, from First Avenue to a point just east of Second Avenue.
September 20, 1930.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)

The same, at a slightly earlier date, showing a more extensive view, to and including the Bowery. At the left appears East Houston Street, west from Eldridge Street. The cleared area, between 1st and East Houston Streets was created by the demolition of the buildings which formerly occupied the south side of the former and the east side of the latter streets, to facilitate the construction of the Independent System (Eighth Ave.) Subway.

P. L. Sperr.

June 6, 1930.

(1)
1st Street, north side, from First Avenue to a point just east of Second Avenue.
September 20, 1930.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)

The same, at a slightly earlier date, showing a more extensive view, to and including the Bowery. At the left appears East Houston Street, west from Eldridge Street. The cleared area, between 1st and East Houston Streets was created by the demolition of the buildings which formerly occupied the south side of the former and the east side of the latter streets, to facilitate the construction of the Independent System (Eighth Ave.) Subway.

P. L. Sperr.

June 6, 1930.

First Avenue, east side, north from 58 First Avenue between 3rd and 4th Streets.

June 25, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.

56-72 1st Street, at and adjoining the N.W. corner of First Avenue. March 13, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.

78 1st Street, adjoining the N.E. corner of First Avenue. April 28, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.

88-78 1st Street, north side, east of First Avenue. Notice the date on No. 88.
March 13, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.

Congregation Beth ha-Knesseth Anshei Podhaycer, 108 1st Street, north side, between First Avenue and Avenue A.
March 13, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.

East 1st Street, east from, but not including First Ave. The view shows a clearance for subway and park construction. Buildings shown on the extreme right, are on East Houston Street, south side, east of Orchard Street.

April 28, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.

First Avenue, at East 1st Street, viewing southward on Allen Street, its continuation below this point.
Views 1 and 2 are photographed southeastward from the downtown platform of the 2nd Avenue "El" line. View 3 is southwestward from the uptown side.

Views 1;2: May 7, 1940
View 3: May 12, 1940

P. L. Sperr

Views 1 and 2 are photographed southeastward from the downtown platform of the 2nd Avenue "El" line. View 3 is southwestward from the uptown side.
